title_review: Amazing little restaurant in the heart of Madrid.
review_preview: I had a wonderful time at Rosi La Loca Taberna. The food was excellent. Roasted potatoes with garlic and chiptole sauce were a great start to the meal. I followed this with croquetas with Spanish ham which were simply mouthwatering. Next was the Spanish omelette...
review_full: I had a wonderful time at Rosi La Loca Taberna. The food was excellent. Roasted potatoes with garlic and chiptole sauce were a great start to the meal. I followed this with croquetas with Spanish ham which were simply mouthwatering. Next was the Spanish omelette with black truffles which was served medium-rare. I was initially not convinced by the concept but surprisingly it worked well, the texture was 'velvety' and the subtle flavour of truffles made the dish very special. Another interesting take on Spanish classics came next in the form of grilled squid stuffed into steamed buns. And again it worked really well. The only little setback here was the 'special mayo' that the dish was supposed to feature and of which there was very little and it also didn't taste much different from a regular mayo. The last dish, grilled pork loin with green salsa and cheese sauce was a great way to finish the meal. The meat was cooked perfectly, the cheese sauce was creamy and flavoursome and the salsa light and refreshing. To accompany the food I was recommended a very nice, fruity white wine which worked very well especially with the squid. Apart from the food it is worth mentioning the really wonderful and attentive staff of the restaurant. Both Ana and David were extremely helpful and accommodating but also the other members of the Rosi crew were very nice and answered all questions and requests with bright smiles on their faces. I can highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to try traditional Spanish food sometimes in a slightly more adventurous form and enjoy the ambience of this cosy, colourful restaurant in the heart of Madrid.

title_review: A must for anyone visiting Madrid!
review_preview: I am someone that does not like to visit a place twice whilst on holiday, so I am somewhat amazed that I ended up in this restaurant four days running during our stay in Madrid. Amicis is such a lovely restaurant visually, but what makes...
review_full: I am someone that does not like to visit a place twice whilst on holiday, so I am somewhat amazed that I ended up in this restaurant four days running during our stay in Madrid.  Amicis is such a lovely restaurant visually, but what makes this place special is the mouth watering food and drinks, as well as the atmosphere and not forgetting the exceptionally friendly staff. We were staying locally, so made a point of popping in every day for either brunch, lunch, dinner and for just a sharing board and wine one afternoon, which we enjoyed on their very sunny terrace! I can honestly say that absolutely nothing disappointed me, and would highly recommend this absolute gem of a restaurant to anyone visiting Madrid, for any occasion. Mark London

review_preview: Nearing the end of our wonderful 2 week visit to Spain, my husband and I were frankly on tapas overload! Seeking out suggestions for other types of restaurants in Madrid, we read a review on this very site for Alright. The high praise given to...
review_full: Nearing the end of our wonderful 2 week visit to Spain, my husband and I were frankly on tapas overload! Seeking out suggestions for other types of restaurants in Madrid, we read a review on this very site for Alright. The high praise given to this establishment not only met our expectations but exceeded them in every way. The cozy warm environment is a true family affair. We were enthusiastically greeted by the owner and his sweet mama. They both offered friendly detailed information regarding the preparation of the homemade food as well as chatting with us. Mama offered to take a photo of us and wrote down the taxi phone number in case we could not find one upon our departure. The ribs with its secret recipe, the tender philly cheese steak and unique mushroom risotto were outstanding. Service was very attentive as if you were personally invited to their home. Additionally the desserts were specially prepared with wonderful texture and taste. We are so glad we found this amazing restaurant before heading back home to the US!

review_preview: Myself and my "difficult to please" colleagues visited Amicis whilst working in Madrid in April 2018. Cutting to the chase: we came back twice in 3 days we loved it that much. We received the warmest welcome on arrival from Fabio and Maria; something most...
review_full: Myself and my "difficult to please" colleagues visited Amicis whilst working in Madrid in April 2018.  Cutting to the chase: we came back twice in 3 days we loved it that much.  We received the warmest welcome on arrival from Fabio and Maria; something most restaurants have forgotten how to do these days. The location and style of venue is relaxing, fun and stylish. The menu was so good it was difficult for us to choose. The quality and presentation of the food was sensational and extremely good value. We washed all this down with some beautiful red wine, chosen by my wine connoisseur colleague; which he rated highly.  Service was at the perfect pace, with staff checking that we were all happy throughout without making you feel pressured.  The atmosphere made you feel at home with people enjoying the surroundings whilst delving into the gorgeous food.  The venue is full of taste and has been brought back to life with revealing some of the original walls of the building - as well as creating a private room for parties which we would love to have made use of with a longer stay.  Thank you Amicis for creating a restaurant which is the epitome of what a restaurant is all about: Amazing atmosphere and food.  We will be seeing you again.  Rob

title_review: Great food, great atmosphere, reasonably priced!
review_preview: Me and my girlfriend, on our first night in Madrid, didn't want to venture too far from our hotel and found 'Alright' through tripadvisor. What a great find it was!We were greeted warmly on entering, and treated very well throughout our meal. The food,...
review_full: Me and my girlfriend, on our first night in Madrid, didn't want to venture too far from our hotel and found 'Alright' through tripadvisor. What a great find it was! We were greeted warmly on entering, and treated very well throughout our meal. The food, starting with mozzarella sticks and having ribs and pulled pork for mains, was tremendous and fresh. Everything you could tell had been made there and then and had the care and attention you would expect from a family run establishment. The ribs, slow cooked for three days were tender and flavoursome, a real delight! The pulled pork sandwiches were exceptional, both dishes accompanied by superb french fries and a hot dip (very hot if you have too much!) which had a superb subtelty of flavour. I loved it.  All in all I would recommend Alright very highly! Very good food, for a reasonable price (you would pay similar if not perhaps even more in the UK), with fantastic service and a great atmosphere ( it was very busy but never stressed). Worth a visit even if needing to go out of your way. Thankyou to the owners of alright for making our meal very very enjoyable.

review_preview: Do not let the name or the environment fool you... From the moment we arrived, as two English men, we were treated like VIPs by the owner and his mother. We were instantly told that we could eat something special "off the menu" that something...
review_full: Do not let the name or the environment fool you... From the moment we arrived, as two English men, we were treated like VIPs by the owner and his mother.  We were instantly told that we could eat something special "off the menu" that something special was an incredible entrec√¥te, shared between two. And wow; what a steak. I am privileged to have eaten in some of the finest steak restaurants in the world and this was easily one of the top 5.  The owner recommended his house wine which was a lovely Rioja that went with our meal perfectly.  Throughout the meal we were attended to as if we were the only people there (we weren't it was 70% full) and every dish was introduced with passion and knowledge.  Our desserts were spectacular and were followed by coffee and grappa on the house.  Although this restaurant is a little out of the way (about 10 minutes in a taxi from the bernabeau) it should be on everyone's must eat list in Madrid.  I shall return.

review_preview: My husband and I had dinner here a few nights ago on our last night in Madrid. From the moment we arrived outside the restaurant till the moment we left everything was just amazing. The owners mother Vicki came out to the taxi and welcomed...
review_full: My husband and I had dinner here a few nights ago on our last night in Madrid. From the moment we arrived outside the restaurant till the moment we left everything was just amazing. The owners mother Vicki came out to the taxi and welcomed us inside. She and all the waiters there are so polite and friendly. She made us feel like family and we instantly felt like we were at home.  The food is to die for, especially the ribs. Just amazing. Be sure to try the fake risotto, delicious! This place is good old fashion cooking at its best. She was ever so kind to shout us a special desert, I'm not sure what it was called but it was just heaven ! You must leave room for desert. After we finished they called us a taxi and the husband waited outside with us. If you are in Madrid be sure to visit this place. You won't be disappointed. Vicki, you are like our second mum and you will always have a second home in Australia!

review_preview: Easy to park and find. The staff was very helpful, energetic and very passionate about their food. The quality was very good. We ordered wings, nachos and burgers. The nachos were the best in Madrid by far and the wings (diablo) were definitely hot and...
review_full: Easy to park and find. The staff was very helpful, energetic and very passionate about their food. The quality was very good. We ordered wings, nachos and burgers. The nachos were the best in Madrid by far and the wings (diablo) were definitely hot and spicy but if you expect something similar to "Buffalo" style hot wings these are not your wings (as they use the Peruvian hot pepper rocoto). The burgers were very good but not the best I have had in Madrid. Perhaps mine was slightly overcooked or the meat was heavily marinated but they were still 7/10. The ribs looked and tasted fantastic. Overall a very cool place, with an excellent offering

review_preview: We stayed in Sheraton Mirasierra Hotel in Madrid and this restaurant is in a walking distance (in European terms). We failed to make a reservation but the owner still succeeded to give us a table for an early dinner (in Spanish terms). I can only...
review_full: We stayed in Sheraton Mirasierra Hotel in Madrid and this restaurant is in a walking distance (in European terms). We failed to make a reservation but the owner still succeeded to give us a table for an early dinner (in Spanish terms). I can only agree with all positive reviews here at Trip Advisor. A small and simple restaurant ... but absolutely delicious food (probably the best ribs I have ever had), friendly, fast and efficient service. I would not call it "American" ... the food is much lighter and much more creative than the typical American stuff. The owner took personally care about us and whatever he recommended was absolutely fabulous. The prices are reasonable ... in a fact taking into consideration the quality of food and service it is pretty cheap. Highly recommended.

We ended up getting 2 items on Juans secret menu one being the "fake" risotto, which was unbelievable. We also got the ribs which were southern and Korean inspired. They were absolutely delicious. So in closing, stop weighing your options, call a cab (or jump on a train!), and go here!

review_preview: We decided to try this restaurant on our last night here in Madrid as it was local to our hotel and the reviews looked promising, we were not disappointed in the least! The owner was so nice, accommodating us without a reservation and then carefully...
review_full: We decided to try this restaurant on our last night here in Madrid as it was local to our hotel and the reviews looked promising, we were not disappointed in the least!  The owner was so nice, accommodating us without a reservation and then carefully explaining each dish. My husband ordered the wings to start with and the ribs for the main course, the time and effort put into them was not lost on him (with 4 days prep before any plate of ribs is served) and said repeatedly that it was the best food he had ever eaten and wants to come back just for the food in this restaurant.  I had the mozzarella triangles with a sweet chilli sauce, which were amazing, but when the owner brought out a sample of the fake risotto to try, I fell in love and asked if I could change my main course order, (having ordered the cheeseburger), they went one better, giving me my cheeseburger (with no bun - they said it would be too much and they were right) and risotto on the side. The burger was amazing, not only was it handmade, the even grind the meat themselves.  To finish I had the station brownie, which was rich and delicious, I enjoyed every mouthful. Everything here is made with love and passion and it's clear why it's one of the best restaurants in Madrid. We will be back for definite!

Alright is a beatiful place and the atmosphere is quiet and confortable it's a good place to go with friends.

The hostess asked how many and we said two and she immediately turned us away and said that they didn't have room. Like I said there were plenty of empty tables. Getting a taxi back to our hotel was a nightmare and not to mention it was cold outside. I'll make sure to stick to the center of the city next time.

title_review: Great food, atmosphere, owner, and staff!
review_preview: Arriving at the restaurant, we were a little hesitant because it was a further cab ride away from the city center of Madrid. We were confused how such a popular restraint could be so out of the way. But don't worry, it's worth the cab...
review_full: Arriving at the restaurant, we were a little hesitant because it was a further cab ride away from the city center of Madrid. We were confused how such a popular restraint could be so out of the way. But don't worry, it's worth the cab ride. Upon arrival, the staff were more than welcoming. The owner came over to us and explained many things on the menu, and even some special items that weren't listed. Everything in the restaurant is homemade except the bread- on Tuesdays, they spend the whole day making the nachos from scratch- both the dough and the condiments. The sauces are all unique and homemade with such detail, time, and thought that makes the dining experience so unique. The owner explained his ways of cooking many dishes and you could tell how passionate he is about food. It translates into the love for his customers and his eagerness for them to try his dishes (he gives free samples!) this is a definite must visit!

review_full: I discovered this place when I moved to live in the neighbourhood. I was pretty surprised when I saw how high it was in TripAdvisor‚Äôs list of all restaurants in Madrid.  I‚Äôve been there many times, and of course is really worth a visit‚Ä¶. if you‚Äôre around.  It‚Äôs a familiar place, but the quality of the food is way higher that the standard family restaurant. Also the service has always been very kind and helpful. Ribs are really great, among the best I‚Äôve ever had. As a starter, I‚Äôd recommend Nachos (although the quantity is a bit short) or Ranch Fries. Hamburgers are quite good (but not the best in Madrid), and as I said ribs are exceptional).  The local is nice and comfortable.  As a summary, given that it is currently #3 in Madrid, I fully recommend it if you are nearby, but it is not worth for people visiting Madrid to travel to Barrio del Pilar to eat here. It‚Äôs a very good American restaurant, but you‚Äôll probably have much more interesting things to do in Madrid with your time.

review_preview: Alright American Restaurant, Calle de Pedro Rico, 54, Madrid, Spain. "Alright ... American food made with love". Waste time and money on American style food when in Madrid, Spain? Not usually but the rating and comments intrigued.Nearly 8 km out from central Madrid but...
review_full: Alright American Restaurant, Calle de Pedro Rico, 54, Madrid, Spain.  "Alright ... American food made with love". Waste time and money on American style food when in Madrid, Spain? Not usually but the rating and comments intrigued. Nearly 8 km out from central Madrid but acceptably accessible by metro (exit Barrio del Pilar station) and about a 10 minute walk. Opens 1400, arrived about 1415 on a Tuesday afternoon and already half full. Table for two available but suspect a reservation might be prudent, was packed by about 1430. Ordered starters/entrees "Smoking Wings" and the (off menu ... ask wait staff) "Fungi Risotto" with shaved Manchego (cheese) and a touch of black truffle. Mains, the flagship "Alright Ribs" and the "Porky's Sandwich".  Smoking Wings nothing special, bit too dry, in (smoking?) sauce plus small supplementary bowl of sauce. Sauce definitely not "smoking" (if meant to imply spicy and hot) ... more like a mild barbeque sauce. Fungi Risotto ... superb. Umm ... well that's about it really ... simply superb. Right up there with the best we've ever had ... anywhere on this planet. If you like mushrooms (and if this was their usual standard), you WILL enjoy. Alright Ribs ... their flagship and a real standout. Unlike the drowned in baste/sauce varying from "pleasantly barbeque" through "too sweet, too sour, too spicy, too bland" served at 99.9% of rib joints ... to disguise the dried out texture, these ribs were almost devoid of sauce and had a "dry rub/light grill" appearance. Incredibly tender and superbly moist with a natural "meat" taste. Literally "fall off the bone", the rib bones could be lifted out of the meat completely devoid of adhering meat tissue. Generous amount of meat. Looking at the menu's claimed "48 horus" (hours) preparation time I think it would be appropriate to suspect a "sous-vide" ultra low temperature cook procedure followed by a "flash grill" for colour (or color if you are from a country that does "English lite"). Highly recommended (no, not "English lite", THE RIBS). Porky's Sandwich ... A light soft hamburger bun with a generous amount of very tender pulled pork drenched in a "just right" barbeque sauce and with a small amount of enclosed salad. Not the "wow" factor of the risotto or ribs but still very good compared to the usual "hamburger style" offerings usually encountered elsewhere. Both ribs and sandwich offered with small accompanying fries or salad. We both chose fries but as encountered elsewhere in Madrid (Spain in general?) they were a rather "limp" shoestring variety. Properly cooked ... but probably for a long time in way too cold oil. Not our preference ... but if that's the way the locals like 'em, so be it. Lubrication, a blanco/white wine of unrecognised label. "2016 Verdejo" (2016 green olive) ... beats me too, but was pleasantly light and drinkable. A "compassionate" 5 out of 5. Compassionate because I consider that any criticism automatically disqualifies a maximum score. However, in this case the overall excellence of the food doesn't deserve downgrading by such a large "minimum amount" (20%) simply because of the mediocre chicken wings. Would definitely "do again".

title_review: One of the best meals of my life
review_preview: As Canadians who live close to Toronto where every imaginable cuisine is available, our curiosity got the best of us. We had to know how American cuisine was going to be served in Spain. WOW. What a meal. As most reviews will tell you, amazing...
review_full: As Canadians who live close to Toronto where every imaginable cuisine is available, our curiosity got the best of us. We had to know how American cuisine was going to be served in Spain. WOW. What a meal. As most reviews will tell you, amazing and generous service, great atmosphere (although we do recommend playing some music perhaps). If you are from North America, do yourself a favour and book a reservation at this restaurant well in advance. We should only be so lucky to eat food this amazing back home. Every single dish we ate was incredible - the pulled pork burrito actually made me feel like weeping. I will dream about it for the rest of my life and if I ever find myself in Madrid again I will beeline it straight to Alright. ***Added bonus is watching the locals eat their burgers with a fork and knife***

title_review: Great food and atmosphere near Madrid airoport
review_preview: Had a dinner with a group of friends while staying in the Madrid Hilton Airport Hotel. The place is a short taxi ride from the hotel, in an old charming building with wooden beams on the ceiling and a very friendly owner. He made us...
review_full: Had a dinner with a group of friends while staying in the Madrid Hilton Airport Hotel. The place is a short taxi ride from the hotel, in an old charming building with wooden beams on the ceiling and a very friendly owner. He made us all feel comfortable as soon as we arrived and looked after us all evening until the final digestive shots which he offered "on the house" We were all very happy with the food he recommended, particularly the fish and the steak. The red wine was so spectacular that we had all the available bottles. We were then offered a better, more expensive replacement at the same price as the previous one. Great service and the feeling we were guests in a friend's house. Dinner at Nuevo Porche will transform your overnight stay in the airport hotel into a great experience. review_preview: Because of an early morning flight we were staying at a hotel in the rather unassuming Barajas residential neighborhood near the airport.   After checking TripAdvisor, we were pleasantly surprised to find this highly rated upscale restaurant literally around the corner from our hotel.  It was...
review_full: Because of an early morning flight we were staying at a hotel in the rather unassuming Barajas residential neighborhood near the airport. After checking TripAdvisor, we were pleasantly surprised to find this highly rated upscale restaurant literally around the corner from our hotel. It was nicely decorated and provided a great atmosphere. We started with sliced calamari rings that were lightly breaded and fried to perfection. For entrees, I had the suckling pig that was excellent. My wife had the monkfish. It was fabulous and much more than expected being served as a whole fish sans head, in a wonderful oil and garlic sauce. For dessert we shared a slice of almond cake and coffee‚Äîa perfect end to a delicious meal and a wonderful evening. This restaurant rates as one of our best meals in Spain and is better than many of the ones we have dined at in downtown Madrid in past years. If you plan to be in the vicinity of the airport or don‚Äôt mind driving a little distance from downtown Madrid for a delicious meal, this restaurant is a definite must.

review_preview: While staying near by the night before our flight we were searching for a nearby ‚Äústeak‚Äù place, this restaurant came up with decent reviews so we tried it and was not disappointed. The food and Service was fantastic but the best part was the cultural...
review_full: While staying near by the night before our flight we were searching for a nearby ‚Äústeak‚Äù place, this restaurant came up with decent reviews so we tried it and was not disappointed. The food and Service was fantastic but the best part was the cultural experience. We were seated and immediately served a teaser: 2 pieces of blended spicy sausage, it was delicious. We ordered a salad for 2, and I forgot they serve fish on their salads but it was still tasty (I did scrape the fish aside): and though we were out for steak which they had; we opted for the 1/4 pig for 2; which was served with potatoes and was very juicy and tasty. The table next to us ordered the steak; again the experience, they bring the cooked dish out for your view them take it back to cut it for serving; the steak is served with a clay grill so each person can cook it to their liking as it is cut/sliced for you. It smelled so lovely and they were definitely enjoying their meal as we were ours. At the end of the meal the bring what we, being American, thought looked like oil and vinegar. We were perplexed as the bread was served first: we asked and they said ‚Äúyou drink a shot of each to help with digestion‚Äù. So we did in Spain as Spaniards do, it gives us a little buzz whatever it was, lol. The best was watching others enjoying their meal, talking with their friends and family, relaxing it really was a social gathering, no cell phones, people actually talking to one another laughing and enjoying good food and Good company.

review_full: I had to leave a review for this restaurant which we visited on Friday 1st June as a hen party of 18 and had the best time. Maria made everything so easy from the initial booking to sorting out food choices and gave us the private room downstairs which was absolutely perfect for what we needed (a bit of space of our own without disturbing other customers). The restaurant itself is really lovely and the food was exceptional with the group having a variety of things from the menu and everyone clearing their plates. In particular the steaks were cooked very well and the sharing boards were perfect and very good value for money.  I want to say a BIG thank you to the bar and waiting team at Amicis who were excellent and dealt with a group of 18 women admirably, going out of their way to accommodate our requests and having a bit of fun with the group, wearing big smiles on their faces - thank you, you added to our Madrid experience and I couldn‚Äôt recommend Amicis more highly, both as part of a group and as a fun, good quality restaurant to visit while in Madrid

title_review: Great food but a bit on the expensive side
review_preview: The atmosphere of the restaurant is great, the staff friendly yet a little over zealous, and the food definitely top quality. What I got to realize was that it's not exactly a place for a leisurely lunch and aims to be more of a fancy...
review_full: The atmosphere of the restaurant is great, the staff friendly yet a little over zealous, and the food definitely top quality. What I got to realize was that it's not exactly a place for a leisurely lunch and aims to be more of a fancy restaurant. Even the starters can set you back upwards of 15 euro and the main courses are an average of 20. If you can overlook the price however, the quality and flavor of the food is incredible, and even the portions are quite large, to the point that they can be shared between two people if you're not too hungry. Overall I would certainly recommend it if you don't mind the price.

review_preview: Determined to get some exercise after a day in the office, I left my hotel and walked the 4km to Alright in the 34oC heat (at 2030). It was an unpleasant walk, but I would have walked twice as long to get to Alright. It's...
review_full: Determined to get some exercise after a day in the office, I left my hotel and walked the 4km to Alright in the 34oC heat (at 2030). It was an unpleasant walk, but I would have walked twice as long to get to Alright. It's name is a real misnomer. This place is exceptional. The staff are very friendly, but also put you entirely at your ease. The proprietor is great and his mother is wonderful. During the course of the meal she brought out three freebies just for me to try - her take on gazpachio soup, little toasts with special salt (delicious but I never found out what was special about them!) and some little fried balls that were very tasty. I went with their recommendation to start, which was very tasty - risotto with truffle oil and mushrooms. Then ribs as per the trip advisor recommendations. The meat simply melted from the bone, in an amazing sauce. Good chips too. I have never before done the thing where you close your eyes involuntarily when you taste something. I did tonight. To top it off, a delicious 'Arab tart' (I think that was the translation) and two ice cold pints of beers on 2 for 1. All for less than e25. So lovely, so tasty, so welcoming. If you like good American food, go at once. Take your friends. This place heartily deserves its no 1 in Madrid rating! Easily one of the best meals I have ever had. It is in the sticks so take the metro or a taxi, you won t regret making the trip.

review_preview: After 2 weeks traveling through Spain and dining in Mediterranean and Spanish restaurants, my son longed for American food.  We found Alright on TripAdvisor and weren't disappointed. In fact, it was incredible.  The ribs were moist and delicious and the barbecue sauce wasn't sugary.  The...
review_full: After 2 weeks traveling through Spain and dining in Mediterranean and Spanish restaurants, my son longed for American food. We found Alright on TripAdvisor and weren't disappointed. In fact, it was incredible. The ribs were moist and delicious and the barbecue sauce wasn't sugary. The burgers were juicy. We ordered the blue cheese and fried leek option--mucho delicioso! We shared four desserts and then argued over which one was best! The most memorable part of our experience was the personal service and visits by the owner and chefs. Juan and his mother are welcoming and generous (they offered us risotto and a 5th dessert because they wanted us to experience them!). Don't miss Alright. It was one of our favorite meals in Madrid!

review_preview: Decided to come to Plaza Mayor with my parents, husband and two kids under 5 based on a recommendation from a friend.  There are a ton of restaurants here especially in the middle of the plaza which should be avoided in my opinion, not based...
review_full: Decided to come to Plaza Mayor with my parents, husband and two kids under 5 based on a recommendation from a friend. There are a ton of restaurants here especially in the middle of the plaza which should be avoided in my opinion, not based on experience but based on personal preference. In short , this area smells bad. So...we looked up Amicis (rated #1) on TripAdvisor, booked a reservation and navigated our way over. The restaurant is a bit hidden (our google maps was not accurate) but worth the effort to find. The place is clean and well kept. There is outdoor and indoor seating but we had a bigger party so we were required to sit inside (outdoor dining is slightly higher in price). It was a bit warm inside but not unbearable. The food is not pretentious but refined so everyone in our party was catered to, even the kids. Burgers, fish, and steaks were all great! Manuel was very attentive, accommodating and made great recommendations. Oh and makes wonderful Caipirinhas! Definitely request him! We will be back!

We had some cocktails (I particularly enjoyed the passionfruit mojito which was not too sweet, just right) the beetroot hummus, a cold gazpacho-like soup, sliced pork, and salmon fettuccine. Everything was excellent, very tasty. Lots of healthy options available. Would definitely recommend and return on another trip.

title_review: Excellent Cocktail, wine, and food with a friendly service!
review_preview: We walked in around 7:30 pm and were received by a friendly waiter, who explained the menu options so we can make a decision. We decided to stay and sat inside as it was a bit chilly that evening. It was not crowded as entrees...
review_full: We walked in around 7:30 pm and were received by a friendly waiter, who explained the menu options so we can make a decision. We decided to stay and sat inside as it was a bit chilly that evening. It was not crowded as entrees in this place dont start till 8pm!! We found a pleasant table next to a window but also overlooking the rest of the restaurant seating. Sergio helped me decide on a cocktail, Mediterranian fresh (a vodka based citrus drink) that was flavorful (of vodka not juice!) and citrusy. A great start after which I switched to Rioja wine (velvet roble). We ordered the Beet hummus (Remolacha) which was outstanding. So was the guacamole y nachos. The pan fresco was plain bread and not toasted but it was v soft and the olive oil and vinegar were top class. For the main course I had Media Tabla verdura. The veggies were grilled to perfrction without losing the flavor of fhe vegetable. The portions were just right with excellent taste. The service by Sergio, who spoke decent English, was perfecto!

review_preview: After the normal trip advisor research, we decided to give Alright a go.....and so glad we did! We turned up without a reservation, and luckily for us they squeezed us in and could not do enough to make our visit special. The owner leads from...
review_full: After the normal trip advisor research, we decided to give Alright a go.....and so glad we did!  We turned up without a reservation, and luckily for us they squeezed us in and could not do enough to make our visit special.  The owner leads from the front, and has a fantastic and infectious personality, carefully explaining each dish. Really attentive and cannot do enough for you.  We had broken eggs to start (share). I'd had this before in Spain but not tasting like this. It was mixed at the table and tasted amazing!! Even my 16 year old daughter who is fussy liked it.  For mains the girls had ribs (to die for) and me and my son had a New Delhi burger and Phili cheese steak. All meals were really well seasoned and tasted amazing. No leftovers!! Finding room for a dessert, we sampled the cheesecake and brownie. In most restaurants the dessert is often a let down. Not here. As much care went into these dishes as they did the main meal. Perfect end to the visit.  As the one who pays the bill, the best thing came at the end, as the bill was really reasonable and the service quick and efficient.  We liked it so much - we are booked in for tomorrow.  If this is the #2 in Madrid - then the #1 must be amazing.

review_preview: We were looking for a place to fill up on some tapas and decided to give this one a shot because it was rated well, and it did not disappoint!We got a big selection of foods, all of which tasted amazing, and was great...
review_full: We were looking for a place to fill up on some tapas and decided to give this one a shot because it was rated well, and it did not disappoint! We got a big selection of foods, all of which tasted amazing, and was great value. The waiter, Monty, absolutely rounded off the experience - he was extremely friendly, professional and efficient, with an impressive memory (he took the orders for our table and the one next to ours by memory, and not a mistake!). He was very thoughtful with the bringing out of dishes as well, so we were only working on 2 dishes at any time, ensuring we got hot, freshly-prepared tapas the whole meal through. We had the patatas in alioli sauce (large), the truffle omelette, chicken wings, croquettes (small), pork loin, and two of the tropical mocktails between 2, and we were absolutely stuffed at the end. You could easily fill up for under 15 euros per person (we went harder and spent about 20 each), and it was absolutely delicious. The croquettes and wings especially stood out for me, but I thoroughly enjoyed every dish. Would highly recommend for anyone looking to get some excellent tapas for a great price, and with absolutely brilliant service!

title_review: Excellent value restaurant with great pizzas
review_preview: The restaurant serves great pizzas from a rather restricted menu: we were in a party of three and selected three of the four pizzas on offer. The same applies to the wine (there was, in effect, one red wine available, unless you like your red...

The same applies to the wine (there was, in effect, one red wine available, unless you like your red wine sweet and fizzy). The pizzas were large, with delicious, thin bases and tasty toppings. We chose the ‚Äúcold meat‚Äù (i.e. salami and prosciutto), mozzarella and pesto and the chicken pizzas, and they were all very good. With pre-dinner drinks and the red wine (which was fine, btw), the meal cost ‚Ç¨55. We had a good time. Just make sure that you don‚Äôt end up seated opposite the toilet. Unless customers decide to close the sliding door, one ends up with a splendid view of the shining toilet bowl through the wide entrance to the loo.

New discover of handmade tigellas, and truffle lasagna,really tasty and forgettable. Service : The waiters are all very professional. They are very helpful and very good listener to make sure that you will enjoy the night. Very smiley people, keep going that way guys! Adil is the chef/manager of Bresca, a big thanks to him to book the all room downstairs for ourself and to make sure that we were having a good time. He took the time to listen me and to organise the event the way I wanna it. Again thanks a lot ;)  Overall: Please do not miss this place. The food, the service and its atmospher is making this place incredibly good. If you want to discover new dishes as tigellas, go there. This is really a "must to do" and if I can say, they should be in a "timeout magazine". Very cosy place to go :)

review_preview: This little restaurant offers an amazing experience that you should not miss out on. Our dinner here is a fond memory that we will surely cherish for a very long time, and I very strongly recommend it.We had the tasting menus at 38 euros...
review_full: This little restaurant offers an amazing experience that you should not miss out on. Our dinner here is a fond memory that we will surely cherish for a very long time, and I very strongly recommend it. We had the tasting menus at 38 euros (there is also a 29 euro version with fewer courses), and the experience was magnificent. There's more than enough food to fill you up, even if you don't stuff yourself with their bread, and the dishes are extremely varied and very, very tasty. We also loved the desserts that the menu came with, and in fact we were simply impressed with every single thing we tasted. It is also important to mention the ma√Ætre; he was bursting with enthusiasm from the moment we walked in to the the moment we left, and he didn't waste a single opportunity to try to make our meal as pleasant as possible. Some other reviewers commented that his outlandish nature lessened the experience, but we found him endearing. It is worth mentioning that you do not have to choose the tasting menu and can instead order √† la carte, although I highly recommend the tasting menu. One final tip is to call ahead and book a table, because the restaurant is quite small and they aren't open for very long.

When we visited Bresca the second time, we had the Tartufina pizza and the tigellas Emiliana. All plates were really delicious and made with fresh ingredients, yummy! Also, we got free Limoncello shots from the waiter which was another plus. Thus, we can highly recommend Bresca and would definitely go there again!

My main course was cod...I was concerned when I heard it was slow cooked, but it certainly wasn't overlooked or tough. One of my friends had lamb shank and the other chose pork ribs, both of which smelled fantastic and seemed to be wonderfully tender. This is without a doubt the best meal I have eaten in Spain, and I would not hesitate to return.

review_full: The gem of Madrid! Hidden away off the main streets, my wife and I had dinner here on our last night in this stunning city. We we warmly greeted from the street by the gorgeous waitress (I think her name was Alejandra from memory), and the night just got better. The atmosphere was beautiful and the food delicious. Lots of locals and tourists, but a busy restaurant didn't mean any table was neglected at all. The kitchen did accidentally send out extra plates or different orders, but was easily rectified with no hassle. The prices were very reasonable and the portions were great. All the staff were exceptional. We thoroughly enjoyed our night. I should also mention we had our 2 year old son who was also well catered to.  100% recommend to anyone in town and we'd definitely visit again if we are. Thank you to the staff, kitchen and management.

title_review: Don't judge a book by it's cover
review_preview: And so one should not judge the food in this restaurant by it's very unassuming appearance and funky decor. I'd recommend reservations if you eating schedule is anywhere near prime tim in Madrid which means 12-4 and 8-midnight.  My wife and I ordered octopus to...
review_full: And so one should not judge the food in this restaurant by it's very unassuming appearance and funky decor. I'd recommend reservations if you eating schedule is anywhere near prime tim in Madrid which means 12-4 and 8-midnight. My wife and I ordered octopus to share, our experience with this dish has often been disappointing so it was more or less an experiment when offered by our effervescent young waitress named Jordan. Well it was the singularly best tasting octopus we ever had and it was the last one of the day and it was only about 6 pm.The fried eggplant (aubergine) which my wife had been comparison tasting all across Andalusia and Morocco for the previous 3 weeks and she pronounced these amount the best.We also shared an excellent bottle of Rioja and had a wonderful dessert.suggested by Monty since we dine over a shift change. Then on top of it all refused a tip because he wanted us to only be happy after enjoying the meal. You'll have to work to find this little gem but it will be with it. Near Puerta del Sol.

review_preview: This restaurant. I barely have words. First of all the building inside and out is so cool. There are plants all up and down the walls and the inside has such a nice welcoming and earthy feel to it. Then the food. We ordered the...
review_full: This restaurant. I barely have words. First of all the building inside and out is so cool. There are plants all up and down the walls and the inside has such a nice welcoming and earthy feel to it. Then the food. We ordered the Burrata cheese ball which comes injected with pesto and in a tomato sauce. Oh my gosh. It was heavenly!! Then we ordered the Spicy Potatoes which is cut up potatoes with cheese sauce on it! Amazing!! And then we had the Huevos Rotos which was potatoes, eggs, and ham. All around the food was so amazing and satisfying and cheap!!! And to add, the service was perfect. Our waiter, Monty, was such a joy! He gave us coupons at the end of our meal for local bars and he brought over free shots!!! If you go to Madrid, you HAVE to go to Rosi la Loca :)

title_review: Nice service and food is good enough,
review_preview: Madrid is a very competitive place for restaurants. For me the rule it's quite simple for not being average: either an outstanding quality or a good value for money. This place is none of the two. Service was quite nice and quick, food was reasonably...
review_full: Madrid is a very competitive place for restaurants. For me the rule it's quite simple for not being average: either an outstanding quality or a good value for money. This place is none of the two.  Service was quite nice and quick, food was reasonably good but portions are rather small and value for money is not great. Summarizing: give it a go if you're not in the mood to look for better options, it won't dissapoint you but you might not remember this place in your top restaurants list.

review_preview: I wish we found this restaurant sooner than our last evening in Madrid; we definitely would have made reservations and gone back. As it was, we found it by accident, wandering the neighborhoods. From the outside, it looked warm, cozy, bustling with happy patrons and...
review_full: I wish we found this restaurant sooner than our last evening in Madrid; we definitely would have made reservations and gone back. As it was, we found it by accident, wandering the neighborhoods. From the outside, it looked warm, cozy, bustling with happy patrons and servers. It was filled with art, music, laughter and amazing smells. We stuck our head in and asked if they had room for us. We apologized that we had no reservation. The host was so accommodating and kind. He really took his time looking at the seating chart and the pending reservations. It would have been so easy for him to just turn us away, but instead he made room. He told us when he would need the table by, but despite that, never rushed us. Even when we were coming up to the time for the next reservation, I tried to catch his eye to pay, and he made it clear that we should relax and enjoy ourselves. All things in good time. All smiles.  As for the food and the drinks: Wow! This South American restaurant was slinging some of the tastiest food I've had in a very long time. (My mouth is watering just remembering our meal). Because we had less than an hour, we chose to have cocktails and split three dishes. We had one of the specials, one of the ceviche, and one of the taco plates, and it filled us up. We also tried the cocktail special which was a mango habanero margarita. A tricky drink. There's many ways it can go wrong. The bartender created a perfectly balanced drink, with a nice amount of smoke, sweetness, and heat. It was delicious. All of our food (and the food we observed around us) was gorgeous, delicious, and perfectly and quickly executed from the semi open kitchen in the back. I recommend this restaurant highly and would suggest reservations. I will definitely return on my next visit to the city.

review_full: This didn‚Äôt pop up on our TA radar for some reason, so we were headed for another highly rated place about a block away. Fortunately for us, the other place was packed so we found Bresca.  Very small, but since we were dining long before the traditional Spanish dinner time, there was an empty table. Four of us shared 2 pizzas and Sangria (of course). We are not huge eaters, but we are not light either. The 2 pizzas were just enough. Not like North American pizza these were very thin crust with very light sauce and mozzarella not grated, but rather melted balls like in a tomato mozzarella salad. The tomato were halved cherry tomatoes. The taste and texture was amazing.  Our server spoke just enough English that we could communicate effectively and took excellent care of us. The entire meal for 4 was just over 50 Euro) Just as we finished the place was completely full with people waiting outside. Of course... it was getting closer to 21:00.

title_review: So unique!! Fun, lively, a foodies heaven
review_preview: Went here on our last night in Spain-- it exceeded expectations! The atmosphere is very South American with fun music and lots of people. It's small and a little upscale and lively but not uncomfortably busy. We were helped by our bartender who was also...
review_full: Went here on our last night in Spain-- it exceeded expectations! The atmosphere is very South American with fun music and lots of people. It's small and a little upscale and lively but not uncomfortably busy. We were helped by our bartender who was also the owner (named Julian). He recommended the ceviche and tropical shrimp. We eat ceviche whenever possible and this was quite possibly the best ceviche ever!! It was white fish combined with strawberries, Peruvian corn for crunch, sweet potato, etc. SO good. The shrimp were small without shells on a crunchy green banana tortilla with coconut rice which was very flavorful and delicious. Everything was superb!!! Had a cocktail which was also great. Didn't have dessert (we were stuffed!!) but the owner treated us to some free samples of a liquor from northern Spain, he even had one with us!!  Overall one of our best experiences in Spain, and I would recommend casa jaguar to anyone

review_preview: We have recently returned from a 4 night city break to Madrid with 2 other couples, which we thoroughly enjoyed. However for the first few evenings had been disappointed with the restaurants we had eaten at in terms of either service or quality of food,...
review_full: We have recently returned from a 4 night city break to Madrid with 2 other couples, which we thoroughly enjoyed. However for the first few evenings had been disappointed with the restaurants we had eaten at in terms of either service or quality of food, but we found this wonderful restaurant for the last night of our trip.  For the last evening we were looking for something a bit special as the trip was to celebrate one of the couples 50th birthdays. After some searching on TripAdvisor we found Casa Jaguar which already had very good ratings. One of our group contacted them via Facebook and following a swift message exchange a booking was made with one of the co-owners Marianno (we also requested candles for a cake as part of the meal). The restaurant nestles down a side street off the Plaza de Santa Domingo and despite the external appearance is surprising large inside. We were warmly greeted by the staff (who were very friendly and attentive) and shown to our table. The food was excellent and had a real South American influence and was very fresh and certainly tasty and by far and away surpassed anything we had eaten thus far on our trip. The cost for the food was reasonable and the wine was not excessively priced either. Marianno made himself known and we were treated to a few shots in celebration of the birthday couple (it was his as well so we bought him a drink). He also delivered on the candles and all in all we had a great time. We would certainly recommend this restaurant to anybody visiting Madrid and statying around the area of the Grand Via and Plaza Mayor. The food is excellent and the staff are warm and friendly

title_review: Add another 5star review the list for this restaurant - YUM!
review_preview: We read the prior reviews and thought "yum". So I booked on line and 3 hours later, we were seated and perusing the menu. The staff are warm and friendly and all that we encountered spoke passable to good English, which is great as my...
review_full: We read the prior reviews and thought "yum". So I booked on line and 3 hours later, we were seated and perusing the menu. The staff are warm and friendly and all that we encountered spoke passable to good English, which is great as my Spanish is very poor. They also had a menu written in English (phew)! We ordered the tuna for starters - Yum! Then I had the Brazillian prawns and my husband ordered the 24 hour Slow cooked Spare Rib. He enjoyed his and I enjoyed mine too. The flavours are well balanced and the serving is generous. We didnt have room for dessert or cocktails. I watched the yong woman making several though and wished I had tried the lemonade and the Pisca Sours, they looked really good. The lemon/lime juice is freshly squeezed and it looked great. The decor is funky and fun and they even have a 1970's style arcade game that you can play for free. I didnt get too, as some yong men were having a lot of fun on it and took it over.But if we had stayed longer, I'm sure you could have had a go. We arrived at opening time, and it was starting to fill up when we left. So booking would be advisable.

We reserved a table this time and had a wonderful time with amazing cocktails and paella. Monty was super helpful and friendly added so much to the experience. Good value again too. 10/10 would come to see Monty again. Great place for good value food and cocktails. The negative reviews just don't speak the truth from what I've read. I hope it's still here when I come back because I would revisit Madrid just for this place.

Located in the near of a metro station it's easy to get to, but far from tourist routes so it's very quiet.  There are always some rice dishes to choose from and there's a menu. We've had the black rice and paella and both were absolutely great and for a very decent price. Moreover I suggest trying the Valencian beer - Turia, one of the best i've had in a very long time! As the other reviews said the service is very friendly and quick, the owner also speaks far better english than he says definitely worth visiting.

title_review: Proper paella in Madrid? This is the spot!
review_preview: I was recommended Allioli by a Valencian colleague, so I knew I had to try it. It superseded my expectations. The starters were amazing, humous, tapenade, peppers, bravas...all light and tasty. They really set up the appetite for the oncoming paella. It is so hard...
review_full: I was recommended Allioli by a Valencian colleague, so I knew I had to try it. It superseded my expectations. The starters were amazing, humous, tapenade, peppers, bravas...all light and tasty. They really set up the appetite for the oncoming paella. It is so hard to find a proper paella once you've left Valencia - or so they say: whether it be the water, the salt, the air...it's very much the same idea as Guinness not tasting right outside Ireland. But here we realised that legend is false, and in Madrid authentic rustic - quality - paella can be found. If anyone is visiting the city you should bring them here. It is a true slice of Spain and you will not be disappointed.

title_review: Yes, eat Japanese while visiting Madrid!
review_preview: At some point during nine days in Madrid you just NEED some good Japanese - But really, I just stumbled into this place like most of my other meals in the city.  There wasn't much to visually indicate this was a Japanese restaurant: the decor...
review_full: At some point during nine days in Madrid you just NEED some good Japanese - But really, I just stumbled into this place like most of my other meals in the city. There wasn't much to visually indicate this was a Japanese restaurant: the decor was organic-euro-chic. If I had paid attention to the name or bothered to look at a posted menu, I might have picked up on the cues, but when I was able to get a seat at the busy bar on a Wednesday night I was pleasantly surprised when the gracious bartender/server, David, gave me an introduction to the menu. Definitely happy to have found this place!

review_preview: One year and a half since it opened and it has become my landmark restaurant in Madrid. Every other time I go down town, I try to savor the delis served in Sr.ItoThe food is simply fascinating, all kind of flavor combinations imploding in...
review_full: One year and a half since it opened and it has become my landmark restaurant in Madrid. Every other time I go down town, I try to savor the delis served in Sr.Ito The food is simply fascinating, all kind of flavor combinations imploding in your mouth the "japo-burrito", the sausage and b√©arnaise sauce gyozas, and their nigiris, eel with foie, butter fish with miso sauce or flamb√© salmon with citrus are a must, simply dilicious. And on top of that, a cozy and friendly atmosphere that you will want to repeat again as soon as you step out of Sr.Ito. Every time a newcomer arrives in Madrid, I take him/her there, since Sr.Ito never lets you down. If I had to describe the kind of food, that would be a Japanese based restaurant with a Spanish touch, but also French, Peruvian and Thai, which makes it a perfect combo. It is true, that sometimes on weekends it is full on and reservations early in the week are the only way to get a table, but on week days it is not so hectic and meanwhile you are tasting exquisite dishes, you can better enjoy the friendly stuff.

review_preview: We had high hopes coming here after seeing the photos on TripAdvisor. It was my birthday dinner, and the experience started off well, with us joking and sharing laughs with the owner, who was welcoming and fun. The seaweed salad and edamame Sr.Ito had a...
review_full: We had high hopes coming here after seeing the photos on TripAdvisor. It was my birthday dinner, and the experience started off well, with us joking and sharing laughs with the owner, who was welcoming and fun. The seaweed salad and edamame Sr.Ito had a nice flavor but was excessively salty. The gyozas were average and nothing special. We ordered a bunch of nigiri, and the rice was room temperature and not the correct temperature (body temperature). None of it had wasabi applied.  We then ordered the matcha and chocolate cake and carrot cake for dessert along with some hot teas. Our waiter set down our teas, which were in glass cups, and one of the cups broke and spilled hot tea all over my leg, causing burning pain! He cleaned the spill on the floor with napkins, but then proceeded to place those dirty, soaked napkins on our table! He apologized profusely and applied toothpaste to my leg to help with the burn. When I returned to the table, the desserts had been sitting out with the ice cream melting. He didn't offer new scoops of ice cream. The carrot cake was too sweet. We each had one bite and didn't touch it again. The matcha cake was good but also on the sweet side.  At this point, we were willing to overlook what occurred, because accidents happen, but the waiter added insult to injury when he gave us the bill and said "everything was ok." Everything was NOT ok. We did not enjoy our dinner, and I left with a burn. The owner avoided us and never came to apologize. He sat at another diner's table next to us chatting with them and would glance over but never approached us after the accident, nor did he offer to compensate by comping the bill or even a portion of it. In the states where we are from, that's how it would've been handled. My godmother voiced her displeasure, to which the waiter repeatedly said it's not his fault and that there was nothing he could do personally. That's not the point. He may not have been able to do something, but the BUSINESS can, and failed to. The waiter finally offered to comp one of the desserts, as if that would make us happy. We don't care about 5‚Ç¨; they can keep it. It's just really bad business how the situation was handled, and we will never be back.

We did have a lovely time: staff was pleasant, miso soup was very good, dessert (pudding and sesame ice cream also) but sushi was just good, it didn't have great shape and some pieces started unrolling. Interior is interesting and all in all it is a good place to eat sushi.

review_full: Unfortunately despite obvious effort and reasonable service there is no escaping the fact that they have failed to understand the aesthetics of Japanese cuisine. I don't think they understand the basic qualities and style required to cook Japanese food and as a result the quality of the food is really very poor. I would even go as far as to say it is disrespectful to proper Japanese cooks to call this restaurant a Japanese restaurant. It's a shame but my advice would be , avoid this if you like Japanese cooking. If you like style over substance and food that does not work or taste right then this is a place for you. I suggest they find a new cook as soon as possible.

Found the same number of locals than foreigners due to the Tripadvisor bias. The complimentary appetizer was seasoned seaweed, very good. Next was sushi: sashimi moriawase, very well cut, good quality and properly kept fresh with a bed of ice, nice! Next nigiri: too sophisticated for my taste but good whatsoever. Uramaki very good. Service was excellent. The bill was on the expensive side but cmon what did you expect? Overall, having already been to #1 and #2, 5/5 but beware this ain't no old school sushi, it is creative sushi!

review_preview: The sushi here is fairly good. The rice was of good quality and the fish tasted fresh. We've had a few nigiri I haven't had before. You can ask for a few chef specials and you won't be disappointed. The price is normal and not...
review_full: The sushi here is fairly good. The rice was of good quality and the fish tasted fresh. We've had a few nigiri I haven't had before. You can ask for a few chef specials and you won't be disappointed. The price is normal and not too expensive for what you get. Another tip would be the Mojito sake, which was surprisingly good.  If you want to have dinner for a couple of hours I recommend that you make a reservation beforehand. Otherwise you will risk that you can only sit for about an hour. The ambiance and decoration also get a + from me. If you are in Madrid and want to have some sushi, this would be the place to go.

title_review: Diamond in the Rough! Great Food & Atmosphere
review_preview: Well folks, this was a first for me. Normally, this is the type of place I would walk by without a second glance. Thank goodness for Trip advisor and its reviewers, as it came up as a great option for the area we were in!...
review_full: Well folks, this was a first for me. Normally, this is the type of place I would walk by without a second glance. Thank goodness for Trip advisor and its reviewers, as it came up as a great option for the area we were in! We walked into this place not knowing what to expect, and were delighted with our meal. The kitchen is open, so nothing is hidden. Everything is made fresh, so dietary needs can likely be met. They had an English menu, and everyone spoke way better English than I did Spanish (how embarrassing for me) We started with the Inca salad (shared with my hubby, plenty enough for 2), and then I had the Risotto, and my husband the tacos. What a treat! All the dishes were bursting with flavor, and delicious. While waiting for our dishes, I watched the owner, change the music, singing as he moved about tidying up, and meticulously clean the bar, wash the glasses, and check the overall appearance of the restaurant. It was a unique experience to watch him take so much pride in his "baby". We spoke with him later, and he was a delightful young man (at least 30 years my junior)! We had great food, some very nice wine (3 glasses), and topped it off with the coconut flan. Yum! We were then rewarded with an aperitif "on the house" (which seems to be a common tradition in this country). All this for under 50 Euros. Please...avoid all those places in the squares, plazas and those scattered everywhere along the tourist paths, walk a few blocks and discover a lovely place to dine, with lots of atmosphere, super clean, and support a local young man with a commitment to serve great food. I am sure you won't be disappointed. After all, I am very fussy about everything...quality of food, cleanliness, decent wine for a decent price, and prefer organic when I can get it. If I was delighted, I can only imagine how you will feel. I attached a menu so you can check it out.

review_preview: We visited Casa Jaguar last night upon reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. I came here with very high expectations that were surpassed by the amazing service and delicious food.Our waiter was very friendly and helpful with the selection of food and wine. I could...
review_full: We visited Casa Jaguar last night upon reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. I came here with very high expectations that were surpassed by the amazing service and delicious food. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful with the selection of food and wine. I could not have asked for a better recommendation: I had the Peruvian potato wedges with spicy cheese as a starter and the Shrimps on green rice with coconut sauce and pineapple as a main dish. Both were perfectly seasoned and very tasty. The pineapple gave the dish a very interesting sweetness. The potato wedges were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside - perfect! I have to say the outside of this place made me wonder if this is going to be worth my while (we were approached by three promoters outside the restaurant trying to lure us into strip clubs), but the food was close to perfection and the service was outstanding. I was really surprised with the bill at the end of the evening: between the two of us we only paid around ‚Ç¨50 - a real bargain! I will definitely come back here!

title_review: Succulent taste of Argentina in Madrid
review_preview: The word seems to be out about this charming little restaurant in the heart of Madrid. Not surprising, given the combination of buzzing atmosphere, personal service from friendly staff, value for money but most of all really flavoursome food. Highlights for us when we went...
review_full: The word seems to be out about this charming little restaurant in the heart of Madrid. Not surprising, given the combination of buzzing atmosphere, personal service from friendly staff, value for money but most of all really flavoursome food. Highlights for us when we went were the Pisco cocktail at the bar, the beautiful cevice, the tuna tartare, the tropical shrimp and the melt-in-mouth sea-bass... And I still dream of that white chocolate mousse. You just have to try it. I just want to add something having read some of the reviews that were written since Casa Jaguar climbed the heady heights of Tripadvisor ranking; this place is a whole package of conviviality, ambiance and good latino food - stuffy clientele looking to nitpick need not venture, you'll only be disappointed! Wholly recommend you check this place out before it gets difficult to book...

title_review: Great restaurant, great atmosphere, great staff and great food!
review_preview: What an amazing restaurant!Although our visit started of a bit rusty (we didn't make a reservation), our dinner at this restaurant was amazing!Around 23:00 we got a table for two by our personal staff. Really friendly guy who took time to explain everything...
review_full: What an amazing restaurant! Although our visit started of a bit rusty (we didn't make a reservation), our dinner at this restaurant was amazing! Around 23:00 we got a table for two by our personal staff. Really friendly guy who took time to explain everything really easily and have some small talk. We decided to take the steak (‚Ç¨28,- for 2 persons) with Red Wine (which tasted very good!) and has some white mousse as a desert. At first the white mousse was done, but 5 minutes after we got disappointed the waiter came to us and said that the kitchen staff made some extra (even though it was late already). That is service! After dinner we got invited to the bar with a free shot.. Really nice staff! The food was delicious. The steak was a bit greasy for my taste, but what an explosion of taste. Really good!! When we visited the restaurant was at #2 of Madrid. 1 day later suddenly it became #1. They definitely deserve this ranking! Price: Our tab was ‚Ç¨53,- which I think is very cheap for what you get. It was sufficient and the taste was amazing! (Including a bottle of red wine and a desert)

title_review: A great place for meat lovers!
review_preview: We came here for dinner after all the great reviews in TA. The place is a very small restaurant, very close to Plaza Santa Ana and Puerta del Sol and it is worth trying to have dinner there.It serves delicious authentic argentinian meat and...
review_full: We came here for dinner after all the great reviews in TA. The place is a very small restaurant, very close to Plaza Santa Ana and Puerta del Sol and it is worth trying to have dinner there. It serves delicious authentic argentinian meat and steaks at a very reasonable price. We had the Argentinian Lomo Alto, medium rare and the quality was great - the meat was cooked perfectly and exactly as we asked for. My only suggesion was that I would like a bigger selection of beer or wine, the menu is quite limited there. Other than that, everything was great and one will have top quality meat in this little gem.

I will definitely return to this restaurant!

review_preview: The Intercontinental brand to me stands for assurance - assurance that you will get a high standard of all services they provide, no matter where you are. Kazakhstan, Hong Kong, Bora Bora - it was always an oasis to me. The visit to El Jardin...
review_full: The Intercontinental brand to me stands for assurance - assurance that you will get a high standard of all services they provide, no matter where you are. Kazakhstan, Hong Kong, Bora Bora - it was always an oasis to me.  The visit to El Jardin was supposed another in a line of nice experiences with Intercontinental. Well, I was very wrong.  I didn‚Äôt expect very innovative food, but definitely good one, classical with a classy service. The shock started immediately; we were served bread and butter and the butter was in plastic single portion packs which one would expect at a breakfast in a 3* hotel, but certainly not at an elegant dinner.  They only had one type of wine glasses and they used it for both white and red wine. The glasses were not appropriate for either. Wine tasting after the bottle was opened - forget about it; they just poured almost full glasses and that was it.  Then they forgot to bring the appetizer to the gentleman hosting the dinner; I felt embarrassed... The food was ok, but really just that. At a serving of jamon costing 29‚Ç¨, one would expect much more than ‚Äúok‚Äù. My tortilla de patates with foie gras and saffron was good, but more due to the foie than to the tortilla itself. I was glad I didn‚Äôt order the pasta since it looked very poor (two guests sitting next to me did it). I had red curry with seafood. Fine, but it was a red curry with yellow color; another in a series of mistakes that evening.  The service was totally confused and inefficient; their poor English making the communication difficult. Serving and removing plates from left/right was not a rule, but random. The absolutely worst sight were the waiters taking plates and then - in the middle of the dining room - scraping the leftovers from several plates in their hands to a single one, just like in a cheap diner or company cafeteria.  Instead of a pleasant, elegant dinner, it was a let‚Äôs-get-over-with-it-ASAP for the twelve of us...

title_review: God food, excellent service, pleasant ambience.
review_preview: We spent 5 days in Madrid and I chose Bloved and Botin ( there is a review) before our arrival and reserved for myself and spouse times.. We were sat in the upper part which has three tables and two booths.There was only a party...
review_full: We spent 5 days in Madrid and I chose Bloved and Botin ( there is a review) before our arrival and reserved for myself and spouse times.. We were sat in the upper part which has three tables and two booths.There was only a party of 4 beside ourselves. I debated between the traditional Madrid stew or the tenderloin steak and my love of red meat won out. I ask for medium rare and had it put back for a minute of so when it was first brought. The meat was very good served with hot asparagus and fries both of which were very tasty and the large chips crispy outside. My spouse ordered the sea bass. It came as three pieces of fillet on a bed of sweet potato and she enjoyed it very much. We also shared a salad for which we specified no cucumbers or onion and it came as requested together with a selection of oils and vinegars. The dessert of pannacotta was nothing special. We each drank a glass of wine with the meal , I a rioja and my partner a Moselle Riesling. The bill came to 100 Euro. We were very happy with the meal and the price in line with what we would pay at home for a similar dinner.

review_full: I chose this restaurant to go with friends as we were able to book a table the same day on a Saturday night (perhaps that was not a good sign). I read reviews on Trip Advisor; t most were very positive, averaging 4 and in the pictures on their website it looked good, so I risked it. But I must say there were only two good things about Dogma; the people that took good care of us and made for a swift service, and the bill that was quite fairly priced (149‚Ç¨ for 4 people, not bad).  However, the food I am afraid left me unimpressed and feeling rather deceived. The fish soup was a thick concoction, edible but not what we expected. We shared a paella de verduras that was supposed to have mushrooms, but there was no trace of mushroom and it was not tasty! An exception: the solomillo (meat) was decent. And finally, the dessert was not only totally insipid (a coffee mousse) but the presentation was very poor too. In addition, the atmosphere and ambience were not at all what I expected. It made me sad. The restaurant is located on Alberto Alcocer, a street whose part closer to Castellana is completely different to that where Dogma is; an unattractive area to walk around.  In conclusion, I am sorry to say that, but I wouldn't go back.

review_preview: This is by far the most amazing restaurant in Madrid. I went with my boyfriend and some friends for dinner, on a Saturday night. First of all, I have to mention that the staff were very service-minded and helpful and tried to make our evening...
review_full: This is by far the most amazing restaurant in Madrid. I went with my boyfriend and some friends for dinner, on a Saturday night. First of all, I have to mention that the staff were very service-minded and helpful and tried to make our evening as lovely as possible. There was no issue with langauge because they both had menus in a English (my boyfriend doesn‚Äôt speak Spanish) and were also fluent in order to describe each and every dish we have ordered.  The food was exquisite, by far the most delicious caneloni we had, also the authentic Iberian Ham and the Tuna tataki composed out of very good quality tuna from top to tail. As a main dish we shared a delicious T-bone perfectly done medium rare. And to end with, 2 delicious desserts, rice bomb and lemon pie. Not to forget about the cocktails, they have a wide variety in the menu and the barman explained all the ingredients it contained. We recommend this restaurant as being the best we have tried by now in Madrid, the food was amazing but the staff didn‚Äôt disappoint either. We will be happy to visit Dogma again soon!

Only one suggestion, If you could provide oil and balsamic with the bread before the meal it would add to the authentic experience. And 1 idea, our local Italian back home serves a mascarpone and Nutella calzone with vanilla ice cream as a desert. I think it would be a great addition to the menu. Thanks again for a great evening. If we‚Äôre ever back in Madrid we will definitely visit again.

review_full: Found this place by accident. Peeked in from the street and the decor looked good. We had just come from plaza mayor and wanted to avoid the crowds and outside plastic tables. We were shown to a table and instantly the environment and good air conditioning made us feel at ease.   Despite being the only customers, we were looked after attentively by multiple friendly staff members. Food and cocktails were amazing. We had paella and a Spanish casserole.  We were even more astounded that despite the high class environment, that the prices were only fractionally higher than the street stalls outside l. We were given excellent service, apertif and breads and concluded that this restaurant represented excellent value for money. Staff were very friendly and we happily gave 20 euros in tips. Unfortunately we are from Australia, otherwise we would definitely be back. Highly recommend.

The portions were also very generous to the point that we couldn‚Äôt finish our main dishes, despite our best efforts.  Definitely worth revisiting time and time again.

This place is highly recommended!

title_review: Fantastic food, great atmosphere and good prices
review_preview: I don't write many reviews, being a busy business traveller, but wanted to make the time to review this treasure which was full of pleasant surprises. In short, the food was excellent as well as beautifully presented; the d√©cor is unique and modern, yet warm...
review_full: I don't write many reviews, being a busy business traveller, but wanted to make the time to review this treasure which was full of pleasant surprises.  In short, the food was excellent as well as beautifully presented; the d√©cor is unique and modern, yet warm and inviting, the service very attentive....and the prices surprisingly not high for the experience.  more detail? The chef was walking around talking to guests (around 23:00) and from him we learned the influence for this creative, modern menu: Spanish base with influences from the different countries where he visited and lived in. different dishes were tribute to Mexican, Peruvian, Japanese, Vietnamese, Chinese dishes. also focusing on a beautiful list of Spanish wines, some are reasonably priced even by the glass. The experience was so positive, that I returned on my second (and last night) in Madrid, this time to try other dishes; and encountered an even livelier ambiance, all around - jby the tables, high tables or at the bar, and great service - especially from Dan and Alberto. I tried a different wine and first course this time, but insisted on taking the crunchy prawns again...The chef, Fernando, was there again, talking to many of the guests.  I hope to bring my husband when in Madrid next, not on business. I recommend this restaurant for friends, couples and business and I am sure, that, like me, you will look forward to returning there.

Stop in for a delightful treat if you are in the area!

title_review: Quality of food was excellent but is it really a brunch?
review_preview: To the point, food was great and the ambiance excellent, the attention as well and it¬¥s well worth the price.  However I think that due to the timing and also due to the types of food, it¬¥s not really a brunch but rather an early...
review_full: To the point, food was great and the ambiance excellent, the attention as well and it¬¥s well worth the price. However I think that due to the timing and also due to the types of food, it¬¥s not really a brunch but rather an early lunch (for Spanish people). They open at 13:30, so unless you are not me....you¬¥ve got to have had breakfast before, ( there¬¥s no way I¬¥m going to wake up even let¬¥s say at 11am and then wait until that time to have a first meal)...normally brunches should be starting around 11ish tops? Additionally, there was very little breakfast food (I seem to recall some eggs somewhere). Anyways, they had calamari with rice that was awesome and also they had bogavantes (type of lobster), they have a guy right there cutting jam√≥n serrano, paella, cochinillo and all great Spanish delicacies. You get your fill with cava or beer (I¬¥m sure there are more options but that¬¥s what I had), the waiters are good and everything is accompanied with a pianist playing nice music in the back (sorry no lady Gaga). Most of the people attending were locals. It was a great experience and would return but I would definitively would eat my breakfast before ;-) PS I heard that kids are half price but did not ask up to what age.

review_preview: Bloved is located in a small hotel. The variety of the menu and the positive reviews appealed to us. The quality was very inconsistent and overall,  the experience disappointed.  The appetizer portions are very large; definitely big enough to share. The egg choices are served...
review_full: Bloved is located in a small hotel. The variety of the menu and the positive reviews appealed to us. The quality was very inconsistent and overall, the experience disappointed. The appetizer portions are very large; definitely big enough to share. The egg choices are served with crisply fried potatoes and were very tasty and filling. (The potatoes were probably sufficient as a lunch entree.) The assorted tomatoes salad was interesting, but the tomatoes were unripe and not especially appealing. For entrees, we ordered the paella and the cod. The cod was not fresh and the taste and the texture were off. The paella was fine, but not great. The service was good.

Overall, worth a visit for great beef and nice atmosphere.

title_review: Great food, but have your cocktail at the bar
review_preview: I chose BLoved based on reviews, proximity to my hotel, and the promise of cocktails, which are emphasized on their website. Indeed, the bar adjacent to the restaurant has a great selection of spirits. But if this is a cocktail restaurant, someone needs to inform...
review_full: I chose BLoved based on reviews, proximity to my hotel, and the promise of cocktails, which are emphasized on their website. Indeed, the bar adjacent to the restaurant has a great selection of spirits. But if this is a cocktail restaurant, someone needs to inform the staff. I had to ask for the bar menu, and when I tried to order a martini from their great gin selection, I was told that I could only order one of the cocktails specified on the menu (the usual sugary concoctions). I've learned that if you have to explain a cocktail in Spain, you're better off not ordering it, so I had some sherry and moved on. The food was terrific, the decor attractive, and the service was professional.

review_full: We dined here last night and were very disappointed with the whole event. Drinks service was slow, and we had to keep asking for more drinks. The restaurant was busy, and there did not appear to be many waiting staff on duty. We mainly ordered fillet steak (i must point out that the steak was delicious) and one of the party ordered Paella. The steaks arrived - the vegetables and chips were cold, and had obviously been sat waiting in the kitchen? The sauce, whilst tasty, was gelatinous in appearance. The paella still hadnt made it to the table. Infact, we had eaten our main course by the time it arrived. The paella was very disappointing- it tasted ok, but comprised of rice, calamari and perhaps small clams or mussels? Not a single prawn, not a single king prawn. We informed the waiting staff, and the paella was not charged for on the bill. The only other good point was the quality red wine which was recommended.

review_full: Hola everyone who is going to Madrid! You cannot miss it.  Restaurant Bloved is in the heart of the city. It is the favourite hangout place for tourists. As you enter the place you are welcomed by the delightful marriage of cut stones and modernity. For those who do not book a table and are waiting, there is a cosy lounge with sofas or drink bar /mojito!!!!!:):)./ The food was amazing. As a starter we had tomato tartare and tuna tartare, oyster with its pearl then the main course was a great steak. All the products were fresh, very tasty and the chefs took great care in selecting food for me /garlic allergy:(:(/. The sommelier, Rafael, very cordial and caring with impressive knowledge of the wine!! I highly recommend going to this restaurant!
